basTopologyMIB.name: basTopologyMIB
basTopologyMIB.contactinfo: Tech Support Broadband Access Systems 201 Forest Street Marlboro, MA 01752 U.S.A. 508-485-8200 support@basystems.com
basTopologyMIB.description: The MIB module for defining Broadband Access System Cluster topology.

basChassisTopTable.name: basChassisTopTable
basChassisTopTable.description: A table of chassis contained in a BAS cluster.

basChassisTopChassis.name: basChassisTopChassis
basChassisTopChassis.description: The chassis identifier of this chassis.

basChassisTopSlot.name: basChassisTopSlot
basChassisTopSlot.description: The BAS slot ID of this card.

basChassisTopIf.name: basChassisTopIf
basChassisTopIf.description: The BAS interface ID of this card.

basChassisTopLPort.name: basChassisTopLPort
basChassisTopLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of this card.

basChassisTopChassisNumber.name: basChassisTopChassisNumber
basChassisTopChassisNumber.description: The chassis number of this chassis.

basChassisTopChassisType.name: basChassisTopChassisType
basChassisTopChassisType.description: The chassis type of this chassis.

basChassisTopSlotInfo.name: basChassisTopSlotInfo
basChassisTopSlotInfo.description: This object is used to identify the number of slots contained in a chassis, the type of card contained in populated slots, and if a populated slot contains at least one ICL link. The length of this OCTET STRING indicates the number of slots in the chassis. The encoding of each OCTET is defined below: bits 0-5 Card Type. bit 6 If 1, slot contains at least one ICL link. If 0, slot contains no ICL links. bit 7 Unused.

basChassisTopStatus.name: basChassisTopStatus
basChassisTopStatus.description: The current operational state of this chassis.

basSlotTopTable.name: basSlotTopTable
basSlotTopTable.description: A table of slots contained in each chassis that make up a BAS cluster.

basSlotTopChassis.name: basSlotTopChassis
basSlotTopChassis.description: The BAS chassis ID of this card

basSlotTopSlot.name: basSlotTopSlot
basSlotTopSlot.description: The BAS slot ID of this card.

basSlotTopIf.name: basSlotTopIf
basSlotTopIf.description: The BAS interface ID of this card.

basSlotTopLPort.name: basSlotTopLPort
basSlotTopLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of this card.

basSlotTopACChassis.name: basSlotTopACChassis
basSlotTopACChassis.description: The BAS chassis ID of the application card

basSlotTopACSlot.name: basSlotTopACSlot
basSlotTopACSlot.description: The BAS slot ID of the application card.

basSlotTopACIf.name: basSlotTopACIf
basSlotTopACIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the application card.

basSlotTopACLPort.name: basSlotTopACLPort
basSlotTopACLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the application card.

basSlotTopNumberOfIfs.name: basSlotTopNumberOfIfs
basSlotTopNumberOfIfs.description: The total number of physical interface on this slot.

basSlotTopIfInfo.name: basSlotTopIfInfo
basSlotTopIfInfo.description: This object is used to identify which interfaces in the slot are an ICL interface as well as the type of ICL the interface represents. This object also identifies each end of the ICL. The encoding of this object is defined below. Each interface is encoded as a 3-tuple. The 3-tuple is defined as follows, <Type of ICL, Local ifIndex, Remote ifIndex>, where 'Type of ICL' in one byte, 'Local ifIndex' is four bytes, and 'Remote ifIndex' is four bytes. There will be 'Number of Interfaces' 3-tuples contained in this OCTET STRING. The values for each element which make up the 3-tuple can be as follows: 'Type of ICL' 0 indicates this is not an ICL 1 indicates active ICL 2 indicates redundant ICL 'Local ifIndex' 0 if 'Type of ICL' is 0 > 0 if 'Type of ICL' is not 0 'Remote ifIndex' 0 if 'Type of ICL' is 0 > 0 if 'Type of ICL' is not 0

basSlotTopCardType.name: basSlotTopCardType
basSlotTopCardType.description: The BAS card class of this slot.

basSlotTopStatus.name: basSlotTopStatus
basSlotTopStatus.description: The current operational state of this slot.

basIfTopTable.name: basIfTopTable
basIfTopTable.description: A table of interfaces on each slot contained in each chassis that make up a BAS cluster.

basIfTopIfClass.name: basIfTopIfClass
basIfTopIfClass.description: The BAS defined class of this interface.

basIfTopIfType.name: basIfTopIfType
basIfTopIfType.description: This is a mirror of ifType defined in the IF-MIB.

basIfTopICLNeighbor.name: basIfTopICLNeighbor
basIfTopICLNeighbor.description: If the value of basIfTopIfClass is icl(1), then this object will identify the ifIndex of the interface at the far side of the link. Otherwise, the value of this object is zero(0).

basIfTopICLMode.name: basIfTopICLMode
basIfTopICLMode.description: If the value of basIfTopIfClass is icl(1), then this object indicates whether this ICL is acting in an active(1) or redundant(2) mode.

basIfTopIfStatus.name: basIfTopIfStatus
basIfTopIfStatus.description: The operational state of this interface.

basRSTable.name: basRSTable
basRSTable.description: A table specifying a list of Route Servers in a BAS cluster.

basRSIf.name: basRSIf
basRSIf.description: The BAS interface ID of a Route Server known by this card.

basRSRole.name: basRSRole
basRSRole.description: This object is used to indicate the role the Route Server plays within a BAS cluster.
